page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This block is a rural area about 11 miles S.S.E of York and is crossed by the River Derwent flowing N.W./S.E..The river is the boundary between Humberside to the east and North Yorkshire to the west. There are two main settlements North Duffield and Bubwith. North Duffield (pop. approx 500) is a friendly attractive village with a village hall, new primary school, Methodist Chapel, sub-post office, shop and public house. It has a central village green and duck pond. Bubwith has rather more facilities, such as fish and chip shop, antique shop and timber yard. On the bank of the River Derwent is the old church, now a shared place of worship.
